intro: Verbascum pilematophorum, commonly known as the woolly mullein. This plant is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. The flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters at the top of the plant. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
